action.action-desc: Mrs. Hayes (for herself and Mrs. McBath) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Education and Labor

form.official-title: To reauthorize the YouthBuild program, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the YouthBuild for the Future Act.

subparagraph.text: by amending paragraph (1) to read as follows:

In any fiscal year in which the amount appropriated to carry out this section is greater than $125,000,000, the Secretary shall reserve 20 percent of such amount that is greater than $125,000,000 for—

clause.text: grants to applicants that are located in rural areas (as defined by the Secretary); and
programs operated by an Indian tribe or for the benefit of the members of an Indian Tribe for the purpose of carrying out YouthBuild programs approved under this section.

subparagraph.text: After making the reservation described under subparagraph (A), the Secretary may use the remaining amount appropriated to carry out this section to make grants to applicants for the purpose of carrying out YouthBuild programs approved under this section.

subclause.text: in clause (vii), by striking 12 and inserting 24; and

clause.text: by adding at the end the following:

subparagraph.text: Provision of meals and other food assistance that is offered to participants in conjunction with another activity described in this paragraph.

Informing participants of their eligibility, and assisting participants in applying, for Federal and State means tested benefit programs, such as the supplemental nutrition assistance program, and assistance provided by the State through the Child Care Development Block Grant Act.
Supportive services for individuals with disabilities to ensure such individuals may fully participate in a YouthBuild program.
by adding at the end the following:

paragraph.text: Consistent with the requirements described under subsection (e)(3), an entity which receives a grant under this section may use a portion of such grant to meet all or a portion of the requirement to provide matching funds under section 121(e) of the National and Community Service Act of 1990 (42 U.S.C. 12571(e)) or any other such requirements under such Act.

subparagraph.text: in subparagraph (A)(ii), by striking youth offender and inserting youth justice-involved individual; and
in subparagraph (B)(i), by striking basic skills deficient and inserting foundational skill needs;

paragraph.text: in subsection (f), by adding at the end the following:

In establishing expected levels of performance under paragraph (1), the Secretary shall consult, on not less than an annual basis, with YouthBuild programs to ensure such levels of performance account for the workforce and postsecondary experiences of youth served by such programs.
in subsection (g), by adding at the end the following:

paragraph.header: Annual release of Funding Opportunity Announcement
paragraph.text: The Secretary shall, to the greatest extent practicable, announce new funding opportunities for grants under this section during the same time period each year such grants are announced.

States receiving grants under this Act shall facilitate access to wage data of participants in YouthBuild programs for the purpose of meeting the requirements of this section. Such facilitation shall not reduce any protections afforded by the State which protect the privacy of participant information.
by amending subsection (i) to read as follows:

subsection.text: There are authorized to be appropriated to carry out this section—
